source.5979aa2b:
iris = load_iris()
data =  np.c_[iris['data'], iris['target']]
df = pd.DataFrame(data, columns=iris["feature_names"]+["target"])
source.e460c011:
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
features = df[iris["feature_names"]]
labels = df["target"]
X_train, X_test, Y_train, Y_test = train_test_split(features, labels, test_size = 0.30)

source.74a6b7ca: Method: Random Forest consists of a large number of individual decision trees. Each individual tree in the Random Forest gives a class prediction and the class with the most votes becomes the model’s final prediction
